meanings.sent1: After a long day, he felt shleppier than usual.
meanings.sent2: She seemed shleppier than her friends during the hike.
meanings.sent3: Even the energetic puppy looked shleppier than usual after playing all day.
meanings.sent4: The wilting flower appeared shleppier with each passing hour.
meanings.sent5: The gloomy weather made everyone feel shleppier than usual.

meanings.sent1: His shleppier movements drew attention during the dance.
meanings.sent2: The shleppier dancer tripped over their own feet on stage.
meanings.sent3: The shleppier penguin waddled comically across the ice.
meanings.sent4: The shleppier clown's antics brought laughter to the audience.
meanings.sent5: The shleppier robot's jerky motions amused the children.

meanings.definition: Carrying or dragging something with difficulty
meanings.sent1: The shleppier man struggled to lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent2: She looked shleppier than usual while carrying the groceries.
meanings.sent3: The shleppier child tried to drag the oversized toy across the room.
meanings.sent4: The shleppier porter huffed and puffed while moving the luggage.
meanings.sent5: The shleppier hiker found the steep trail even more challenging.
